reviews.text: Train Station in Hunt's Cross, you can get trains to Liverpool, Widnes and Warrington from here.

Fairly bleak and depressing, especially at night, when you might also find the waiting shelter is locked. However, the original station building (now a restaurant) is quite impressive and an interesting piece of railway history. Merseyrail trains into Liverpool fairly frequent with direct services from Liverpool to Manchester Oxford Road (and vice versa) running every 1 or 2 hours, depending on the time of day. Small car park, bike rack and staffed ticket office.

This is the Merseyrail terminus the southern most end of Northern Line. Other operators have through trains to other cities. Platforms can be accessed via ramps or a lift situated near to the ticket office. A toilet is available at the rear of the cafe at platform level.
An attractive Grade II listed railway station. The Southern terminus of the Merseyrail Northern Line.
